00022 /* standard includes. */
00023 #include <stdio.h>
00024 #include <stdlib.h>
00025 #include <string.h>
00026 #include <ctype.h>
00027 
00028 /* my includes. */
00029 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00030 #include "program_structures.h"
00031 
00032 /* function prototypes. */
00033 static char *save_string (unique);
00034 LIST *init_list (void);
00035 void free_list (LIST *);
00036 bool enter (LIST *, unique, cint);
00037 void print_line (FILE *, LIST *, cint);
00038 static void memory_error (FILE *, cint);
00039 
00040 /* global variables. */
00041 static unique out_of_memory = "Error: Out of memory.";
00042 static unique default_line = "A list of lines of chars." "\n";
00043 
00044 /* functions. */
00045 /* the following function prints an error message
00046    as far as memory allocation error is concerned. */
00047 static void
00048 memory_error (FILE * stream, cint exit_code)
00049 {
00050   /* print the error. */
00051   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", out_of_memory);
00052 
00053   /* exit with the appropriate error code. */
00054   exit (exit_code);
00055 }
00056 
00057 /* the following function allocates enough memory
00058    space in order to save `string'. after that it
00059    returns the address of the space allocated. */
00060 static char *
00061 save_string (unique string)
00062 {
00063   char *new_string;
00064 
00065   /* allocate enough memory space. */
00066   new_string = (char *) malloc (strlen (string) + 1);
00067 
00068   /* allocation failed? */
00069   if (new_string == NULL)
00070     memory_error (stderr, 8);
00071 
00072   /* save and return. */
00073   strcpy (new_string, string);
00074   return (new_string);
00075 }
00076 
00077 /* the following function allocates enough memory
00078    space in order to create a `line' node. after
00079    that the function initializes and return it. */
00080 LIST *
00081 init_list (void)
00082 {
00083   LIST *new_list;
00084 
00085   /* allocate enough memory space. */
00086   new_list = (LIST *) malloc (sizeof (LIST_NODE));
00087 
00088   /* allocation failed? */
00089   if (new_list == NULL)
00090     memory_error (stderr, 8);
00091 
00092   /* initialize the list. */
00093   new_list->index = 0;
00094   new_list->line = save_string (default_line);
00095   new_list->next_ptr = NULL;
00096 
00097   /* return the address of the list. */
00098   return new_list;
00099 }
00100 
00101 /* the following function deallocates all the
00102    nodes from the list given. when all nodes
00103    are deallocated it returns. */
00104 void
00105 free_list (LIST * linked_list)
00106 {
00107   while (linked_list != NULL)
00108     {
00109       LIST_NODE *next = linked_list->next_ptr;
00110       free (linked_list->line);
00111       free (linked_list);
00112       linked_list = next;
00113     }
00114 }
00115 
00116 /* the following function adds a new node to an
00117    ordered linked list. each node contains a line
00118    of chars and a line index which specifies it.
00119    also, it contains a pointer to the next node. */
00120 bool
00121 enter (LIST * first_ptr, unique line, cint index)
00122 {
00123 
00124   int result;                   /* is used for some error return checks. */
00125   int i;                        /* is used for a loop dealing with the line. */
00126 
00127   /* is there any none space character. */
00128   int any_space_char = 0;
00129 
00130   LIST_NODE *before_ptr;
00131   LIST_NODE *after_ptr;
00132   LIST_NODE *new_node_ptr;
00133 
00134   /* either accept or ignore the line. */
00135   for (i = 0; i < strlen (line); i++)
00136     {
00137       /* check to see if the first char is a comment one? */
00138       /* if it is, we ignore it becase it's a comment. */
00139       if (line[i] == '#' || line[i] == '!')
00140         return false;
00141 
00142       /* have we found at least one none space character? */
00143       /* if we have then we accept the line as simple sentence. */
00144       if (!isspace (line[i]))
00145         {
00146           any_space_char = 1;
00147           break;
00148         }
00149     }
00150 
00151   /* is there any none space char in the line? */
00152   if (!any_space_char)
00153     return false;
00154 
00155   /* try to enter the line. */
00156 
00157   before_ptr = first_ptr;
00158   after_ptr = before_ptr->next_ptr;
00159 
00160   /* ordering. */
00161   while (true)
00162     {
00163       /* end of list or empty list? */
00164       if (after_ptr == NULL)
00165         break;
00166 
00167       /* the node has the same line index?
00168          if true entering is not necessary. */
00169       if (after_ptr->index == index)
00170         return false;
00171 
00172       result = strcmp (after_ptr->line, line);
00173 
00174       /* the node has the same line of chars?
00175          if true entering is not necessary. */
00176       if (result == 0)
00177         return false;
00178 
00179       if (after_ptr->index > index)
00180         break;
00181 
00182       after_ptr = after_ptr->next_ptr;
00183       before_ptr = before_ptr->next_ptr;
00184     }
00185 
00186   /* create a new node in order to save the elements. */
00187   new_node_ptr = (LIST_NODE *) malloc (sizeof (LIST_NODE));
00188   new_node_ptr->index = index;
00189   new_node_ptr->line = save_string (line);
00190 
00191   /* update pointers. */
00192   before_ptr->next_ptr = new_node_ptr;
00193   new_node_ptr->next_ptr = after_ptr;
00194 
00195   /* a new node added. */
00196   return true;
00197 }
00198 
00199 /* the following function searches an ordered
00200    linked list and prints the node where its
00201    line index is equal to `index'. */
00202 void
00203 print_line (FILE * stream, LIST * first_ptr, cint index)
00204 {
00205   LIST *cur_ptr;
00206 
00207   for (cur_ptr = first_ptr; cur_ptr != NULL; cur_ptr = cur_ptr->next_ptr)
00208     if (cur_ptr->index == index)
00209       fprintf (stream, "%s", cur_ptr->line);
00210 }
